articles.title: Australian HIV infections are at a new low, but concerns over late diagnoses persist. What can be done? - SBS News
articles.description: Almost half of the new reported HIV cases in Australia were late diagnoses — the highest proportion in more than three decades. What can be done to tackle this?
articles.content: Almost half of the 552 new HIV cases detected in Australia last year were late diagnoses. Experts have stressed the importance of regular sexual health testing. Source: Getty, AFP / Juan Mabromata
